cellot.utils package#

Submodules#

cellot.utils.evaluate module#

cellot.utils.flags module#

Helper functions regarding flags.

cellot.utils.flags.collect_serializable_flags(flags: absl.flags._flagvalues.FlagValues, keyflags=False)#

Collects all serializable flags.

Parameters

  • flags – flags.FlagValues containing the configuration information.

  • keyflags – bool, whether to only return key flags. Default is False.

A serializable object is able to be transformed into a stream of bytes, so that recovering the identical object from the stream is possible.

Returns

A dict containing all serializable flags.

cellot.utils.flags.flags_to_json(cfg, blacklist=None, keyflags=False)#

Puts flags into a dict to be stored by json format.

Parameters

  • cfg – flags.FlagValues containing the configuration information.

  • blacklist – list specifying which flags NOT to be stored. Default is None.

  • keyflags – bool, whether to only return key flags. Default is False.

Returns

A dict with its keys being flags’ names and its values being flags’ values.

cellot.utils.flags.get_flagdict(cfg: absl.flags._flagvalues.FlagValues, keyflags=False) → dict#

Returns the dict of module_name -> list of defined flags.

Parameters

  • cfg – flags.FlagValues containing the configuration information.

  • keyflags – bool, whether to only return key flags (flags one defines in the code). Default is False.

Returns

A dict, with keys being module names (str), and values being lists of Flag objects.

cellot.utils.flags.rank_flag_module(item)#

Sorts tensorflow and absl flags to the last.

Parameters

item – a key-value pair.

Returns

A tuple of the key and its rank information.

cellot.utils.flags.write_flagfile(path, cfg=None, include_json=False, mode='w', **kwargs)#

Stores absl.flags to a flagfile.

Parameters

  • path – str, filepath where the flags are to be stored.

  • cfg – absl.FlagValues, configuration to be stored. Default is None.

  • include_json – bool, whether to store another json file. Default is False.

  • mode – str, the work mode. Default is ‘w’.

  • **kwargs – additional arguments.

cellot.utils.helpers module#

class cellot.utils.helpers.DotDict#

Bases: dict

dot.notation access to dictionary attributes

cellot.utils.helpers.dump_config(path, config: ml_collections.config_dict.config_dict.ConfigDict)#

Dumps the configuration to the specified path.

Parameters

  • path – where to store the config.

  • config – configuration to be stored.

cellot.utils.helpers.flat_dict(d, parent_key='', sep='.')#
cellot.utils.helpers.load_config(path: str, unparsed=None) → ml_collections.config_dict.config_dict.ConfigDict#

Loads configuration from storage.

Parameters

  • path (str) – specifies the location where the configuration is stored.

  • unparsed – configuration that needs to be parsed. Default is None.

Returns

A ConfigDict that contains the configuration information.

cellot.utils.helpers.nest_dict(d, sep='.', as_dot_dict=False)#
cellot.utils.helpers.parse_cli_opts(args) → dict#

Parses command line options.

Parameters

args – options to be parsed.

Returns

A dict containing the parsed options.

cellot.utils.helpers.parse_config_cli(path, args) → ml_collections.config_dict.config_dict.ConfigDict#

Loads configuration and parses command line arguments.

Parameters

  • path – filepaths from where the configuration is loaded.

  • args – command line arguments to be parsed.

Returns

A ConfigDict containing config info.

cellot.utils.helpers.split_rec(k, v, out, sep='.', as_dot_dict=False)#
cellot.utils.helpers.symlink_to_logfile(loglink)#
cellot.utils.helpers.write_metadata(outpath, argv)#

Writes the metadata of the program.

Includes info about the program, its arguments and executed time.

Parameters

  • outpath – filepath to store the metadata.

  • argv – arguments to be saved.
